_comment: Created by EFisher on 17/02/2016 18:39:19 using v2.7
title: How many elective operations have been cancelled and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary:
The number of cancelled elective operations fluctuates over time from quarter to quarter, but in any given financial year there are peaks in quarter 4. This is likely due to hospitals dealing with winter pressures.

However, the overall trend is that there has been an increase in the number of cancelled elective operations. There were 6,786 more cancelled elective operations per quarter between quarter 1 of 1994/95 and quarter 3 of 2014/15. Over 20 years, between quarter 4 of 1994/95 and quarter 4 of 2014/15, this represents a 29 per cent increase.
